page.title: 06STOW LODGE HOSPITAL
page.content: The lodge was built in 1765. Originally it was a workhouse which has developed into a hospital.It was included in the National Health Service in 1942. The elderly,the young,the physically disabled and anyone in the community who has a doctor at Stowmarket Health Centre can use the hospital. There are 5 wards in the Lodge and 179 nurses although not all of them work full time.If however all the staff were full time they would only need 133 staff.Physiotherapists,speech therapists,dieticians,cooks,hair dressers and cleaners are also employed. 111 patients stay over night at the lodge and 24 are just day patients, making a total of 135 patients.
